answers.answer: Well, with each of my pregnancy I had to do the 24hr. test many times! With Hunter I had to do it 2times very early in the pregnancy and One more time at the end! I wouldnt worrie unless ou have too, if you are not having any other sym.. Try and take is easy at work and hopfully you will not have to go on leave......By the way I LOVE THE NAME!!!I hope it all works out Ok!! ((((hugs))))toni

I have gone in twice and have had protein in my urine....and then the last time I did not.It can also be caused by eating something sweet/or too much sweets in that day.Every woman's body is different but they did tell me that what you eat can affect the levels in your urine.I wish you the best of luck Laura and lets just hope that the protein goes away and that Jaxson stays in there as long as he possibly can (of course, not overdue!)steph

I don't know about the protein in the urine, but if you happen to have the guy early, they probably wait till 32 weeks.  You know both my kids were early, and their perfectly fine and healthy.  They would give you a shot to speed up lung development to help him out.  And even though he'd be in the nursery, it's the make sure he is doing what all he needs to be doing!  My son was 5 weeks early, and I had to have the shot (they say they hand them out left and right with boys because their lungs develop a little slower) and by 6 months he was 24 flipping lbs!  You'd never know he was early!  By a year he was 36 lbs!!  And he isn't fat!  He is tall and a mofo!  LOLI hope everything turns out fine, and I hope his father will decide to help you out more if you have to get taken out of work!  I am really sorry this is happening, but I think everything will be fine!  Keep us posted though!

Hey hon!I'm sorry you're having so many things go "wrong".  Like the other girls have said, don't worry too much about the protein because it could be something you ate too.  If you do have preeclampsia, then your doctor will let you know.  I've been monitoring my blood pressure at the local Wal-mart (even tho their machines are not as accurate as the nurses at the dr's office) because, aside from gest. diabetes, I'm afraid of having preeclampsia.Hopefully everything with you and Jaxson are fine!  I know you don't want to have him too early, but if it's better for you and him, then it's what you have to do.  I know you've talked about the stress you've had at work, dealing with the no maternity leave thing ...like ashiepooh said, hopefully Jaxson's dad can help you out when you do have to leave work.*hugs*  If you need to vent/rant/talk more, just send me a message!

Oh hunny Im sorry, It sounds like you have had a hard time so far! BUT It will all be worth it in the end.....I dont know too much about the protein in the urine but that it can possibly mean preeclampsia. BUT that doesnt mean you have it for sure.... just hang in there and do the tests and we will be keeping our fingers crossed for you and baby jaxson! Keep us posted
Thanks everyone!Your support means soo much to me. It feels good to get it out and feel like I can rant here.. Thanks to all of you fabulous ladies!! (and Medhelp too, of course!)
Laura you can vent anytime you would like to!!!  :)

Oh no...how stressful!  I hope K is being supportive!    I hope that your pee is good this time!!!  Hopefully things will get better!  I can't believe work is being difficult on top of all your other problems!  I had to leave today with little notice and my boss was so nice.  I wish your boss will have a change of heart!

question: Well, I am home for the day "peeing in a bucket for 24 hours." My urine has come back 3 weeks in a row w/ protein. My Dr. is worried about preeclampsia. I am a nervous wreck. I had placenta previa w/ bleeding (now corrected itself) Been in the hospital for a 3 day stay b/c I was having contactions and they had me on meds 3 days to stop them. I have been dehydrated, the first 15 weeks I was throwing up every day.. I am feeling like this pegnancy has been sooo problematic. I am only 27 weeks and terrified something is going to go very wrong. I think I am looking for reassurance and I am looking for more information on protein in urine.Any advice or stories would be appreciated..My Dr. was saying that due to my issues thus far, there is a 50/50 chance that I will be taken out of work and have Jaxson early.. I dont want him to be early, I want him to be normal and healthy. On top of that,my work has been A-holes, and I have no sick or vacation time, and I dont qualify for short term disability. I have NO idea how I will survive if I get taken out of work.. I am sooo stressed out. Thanks for reading..Laura
title: 24 hour urine tests
